definition: Nana (name)/Nana (1880 novel by Émile Zola)/Nana (Japanese manga series)
(phonetic na)/used esp. in female names such as Anna 安娜[An1 na4] or Diana 黛安娜[Dai4 an1 na4]
(phonetic na)/used esp. in female names such as Anna 安娜[An1 na4] or Diana 黛安娜[Dai4 an1 na4]

sentences.english: Nana pulled an all-nighter to study for her math exam.
sentences.chinese: 为了应付数学考试，娜娜学了一个通宵。

sentences.english: Yijia is upset at losing Nana as a client and breaks up with Xin An on the spot.
sentences.chinese: 怡嘉因失去娜娜这个大客户而气得当场与信安分手。
娜娜当然是没有恶意的。

sentences.english: Directed by the warlike Inanna, he penetrates the Sinai peninsula, invades Egypt.
sentences.chinese: 受到好战的伊娜娜指引，他渗透西奈半岛，入侵埃及。

sentences.english: Nana despises Yijia when she finds out that Big Foot is her father.
sentences.chinese: 娜娜发现大脚是怡嘉的父亲后立刻看不起怡嘉。

sentences.english: Nana rests her case when she finds out that Michael is Jufu's elder son.
sentences.chinese: 娜娜知道麦可是居福的儿子后立刻息事。

sentences.english: Zhang is still waiting to reconcile with her family.
sentences.chinese: 张娜娜仍然等待着能够与家人和好。

sentences.english: Banana Yoshimoto's new book is out now, I want to buy it.
sentences.chinese: 吉本芭娜娜的新书已经上市了，我想买一本。

sentences.english: Nana scolds Yifan and even tugs Yifan's hair.
sentences.chinese: 娜娜上学校投诉，还撤一帆的头发。

definition: (Tw) (Internet slang) Greetings! (used when it's unknown what time the reader will see one's post, or just to be cute)
lit. little princess/fig. spoiled girl/female version of 小皇帝[xiao3 huang2 di4]
(phonetic na)/used esp. in female names such as Anna 安娜[An1 na4] or Diana 黛安娜[Dai4 an1 na4]
one of the three main divisions of the Book of Songs 詩經|诗经
used in the transliteration of people's names
